articleList.title: What is µTorrent Lite & how does it work?
articleList.description:
Stream torrents without an app. The fastest, easiest way to play torrents inside your browser.


Supporting Operating SystemsSupporting Browsers
WindowsChrome
MacOSSafari
ChromeOSEdge
iPadOS
Android OS


Following the launch of BitTorrent/µTorrent Web, our popular torrent streaming clients, µTorrent Lite (beta) expands on our vision to offer simple, decentralized tools for the browser. Available at https://www.utorrent.com/lite/, µTorrent Lite allows you to stream torrents on popular devices, including desktop PCs, Macs, Chromebooks, iPads, Android and more. Supporting Chrome, Edge, and Safari, you can play torrent files without needing additional applications, such as BitTorrent/µTorrent Web or Classic. 

 

µTorrent Lite is an evolution of WebTorrent, an open-source protocol and technology that was introduced by the developer community to power a decentralized browser-to-browser network for transferring large files. With µTorrent Lite, you only need to have the .torrent file downloaded, or the magnet link copied to your clipboard. If you drag the torrent file from a folder on your computer, or paste the magnet link into https://www.utorrent.com/lite/, the site accesses torrents seeded by the community and figures out the fastest way to assemble each piece of the file so you can stream the files in near real time. Because µTorrent Lite streams torrents from your browser’s memory, it does not download the actual files to a folder on your device. If you are looking for a simple way to play torrents that are video or audio-based files and don’t want to install additional applications, µTorrent Lite is a great choice.

articleList.title: How do I get started with µTorrent Lite?
articleList.description:
First, make sure you are running a supported browser, including Chrome, Edge or Safari. The next step is to find a .torrent file or a magnet link. If you are on a desktop PC, Chromebook, or Mac, you can drag the torrent file from the folder on your computer into µTorrent Lite, which is available at https://www.utorrent.com/lite/. Alternatively, you can paste the magnet link into the open field on https://www.utorrent.com/lite/. Both of these actions will begin the process of streaming your torrent file. If you need practice, below are some helpful tips once you have found a .torrent file or a magnet link:

 

For .torrent files

Find the torrent file you want to play, then click to download the .torrent file and save to your Downloads folder or your Desktop. Next, just drag the torrent file and drop it into the µTorrent Lite website.

If you are using an iPad, tap the torrent file and then tap ‘Download’ to save the torrent file to the Files folder on your iPad. Next, navigate to https://www.utorrent.com/lite/ and tap on ‘Choose a torrent file’, then tap ‘Choose Files’ and select the .torrent file that is in your Files folder. 

 

For magnet links

Find the torrent file you want to play, then copy the magnet link  to your clipboard. On Windows, right-click, then select ‘Copy link address’. Next, paste the magnet link into the µTorrent Lite website (CTRL+V).

On Mac, select Command-C or choose Edit > Copy. Next, paste the magnet link into https://www.utorrent.com/lite/ (Command-V).

On an iPad, tap and hold the magnet link to copy it to your clipboard. Next, navigate to https://www.utorrent.com/lite/ and tap into the open field to paste the magnet link, then tap ‘Go’.

articleList.title: How fast can I stream a torrent file?
articleList.description: That depends on the quality of your Internet connection and the number of quality peers (users seeding) for your torrent file. The number of peers can be found below the player window when you load a torrent file into https://www.utorrent.com/lite/. If you see a ‘Low peers’ dialog next to the number of peers, then you may experience buffering or may not be able to play the file at all. Potential solutions are to try the torrent again when more peers are available or try to find a different .torrent file with more seeders.

articleList.title: What are peers? What happens if there aren’t enough peers?
articleList.description:
Peers refer to the number of users that have the file and are seeding (sharing). If the torrent file has a healthy number of peers, it should result in faster and more reliable file transfer and a quality streaming experience. If your torrent file has zero or few peers (i.e., few people are sharing the file), you may experience buffering, or may not be able to view the file at all. 

To monitor the number of peers after you have started a torrent stream, look to the bottom of the player window and count the number of active peers (seeders). If you run into problems with the quality of the stream, or the media cannot play at all, it may be due to a low number of peers, or no peers at all. If this is the case, try to find a different torrent file or keep the existing torrent file and try again later. You might find that more seeders come online, and the file becomes more available to stream.

articleList.title: How do I share torrents on µTorrent Lite?
articleList.description:
The share feature is a great way to share torrents with others who don't have previous torrenting experience, or who don’t want to download client software like µTorrent Classic or µTorrent Web. Your friends and family only need a strong Internet connection and Chrome, Edge or Safari to be able to open torrent files and play. 

Before you can start sharing, first you will need to play a torrent on https://www.utorrent.com/lite/ by finding a .torrent file or a torrent magnet link for the playable media that you are looking for. From there, you can leverage https://www.utorrent.com/lite/ to play it. Please follow the below instructions to start sharing:


Step 1: Click on the ‘Share’ icon below the µTorrent Lite player.

Step 2:  Click to copy the message and the torrent magnet link to your clipboard. 

Step 3: Paste the message into an email or instant message and send it to a friend or family member. 

Step 4: When your friends click on the magnet link, it will open and play on https://www.utorrent.com/lite/.
